Title: Object: Lanusse
Description: Portrait of either François or Pierre-Robert Lanusse, bust in profile to right, with hair tied at the back, wearing high-collared jacket; illustration to Reybaud's "Histoire scientifique et militaire de l'expédition française en Égypte" (Paris: Denain, 1830-36) Etching
Curator's comments: François and Pierre-Robert Lanusse were brothers; both accompanied Napoleon to Egypt and the series features portraits of both (the other being 1925,1214.70), but the titles do not identify them by their first name.
Bibliographic references: De Vinck 1909-1967 / Collection De Vinck. Un siècle d'histoire de France par l'estampe. Inventaire analytique. (undescribed)
Associated titles: Histoire scientifique et militaire de l'expédition française en Égypte
Acquisition name: Donated by: David Alexander Edward Lindsay, 27th Earl of Crawford and 10th Earl of Balcarres
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford
Acquisition notes: 1925,1214.4 to 140 consists of portraits of Napoleonic generals and other such persons. The prints all come from the collection of the donor's father, and the gift consists of lots bought in at the sale of that collection at Sotheby's 1/2 December 1925.
